ProxyGroup.name: filters
ProxyGroup.SourceProxy:
Given an input scalar field and a list of critical points to remove, this plugin minimally edits the scalar field such that the listed critical points disappear. This procedure is useful to speedup subsequent topological data analysis when outlier critical points can be easily identified. It is also useful for data simplification.
The list of critical points to remove must be associated with a point data scalar field that represent the vertex global identifiers in the input geometry.
Note that this plugin will also produce an output vertex offset scalar field that can be used for further topological data analysis tasks to disambiguate vertices on flat plateaus. For instance, this output vertex offset field can specified to the ContourForests, IntegralLines, or ScalarFieldCriticalPoints plugins.
Also, this plugin can be given a specific input vertex offset.
Related publications: "Generalized Topological Simplification of Scalar Fields on Surfaces" Julien Tierny, Valerio Pascucci Proc. of IEEE VIS 2012. IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics, 2012.
"Localized Topological Simplification of Scalar Data" Jonas Lukasczyk, Christoph Garth, Ross Maciejewski, Julien Tierny Proc. of IEEE VIS 2020. IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
See also ScalarFieldCriticalPoints, IntegralLines, ContourForests, Identifiers.
